campaign.component.voting.instructions1: Go to the Proposals tab and you will see the voting options under each proposal.
campaign.component.voting.instructions2: The Voting Ballot allows non-appcivist users to vote. They will have to first fill a Voting Registration form configured by the Assembly Coordinators.
campaign.create.themes: What are the themes of the campaign?
campaign.creation.linkedCampaignExplanat: If enabled, deliberation, voting and implementation will take place according to the rules established by the linked campaign organizing assembly, '{{title}}'. Therefore, users will only deliberate and vote once, within that linked campaign. If disabled, users will deliberate and vote within their our Assembly Campaign and again within the Linked Assembly Campaign.
campaign.creation.linkedExplanation: If enabled, deliberation, voting and implementation will proceed according to the rules set by the parent Assembly of the linked campaign, '{{newCampaign.linkedCampaign.title}}'. Therefore, users will only deliberate and vote once, within that linked campaign. If disabled, users will deliberate and vote within their our Assembly Campaign and again within the Linked Assembly Campaign.

component.deliberation.about: is the careful consideration of proposals through comments and evidence. In this stage, proposals can only be discussed, praised or criticized, but not edited.
component.implementation.about: allows assembly members to follow the progress of winning proposals or to find new opportunites for proposals that were not selected durin the voting stage.
component.proposal.about: is about raising issues, brainstorming ideas, forming working groups, and starting proposals
component.voting.about: determines the winning proposal/s, based on the voting system selected and the number of winners allowed.
component.voting.system.winners.DYNAMIC1: Dynamic 1: first N-ranked proposals that can be fully funded by available budget (may result in unspent funds)
component.voting.system.winners.DYNAMIC2: Dynamic 2: first N-ranked proposals that can be fully funded by available budget, allocating all the funds (may result in 'leapfrogging')

creation.components.newCampaign1.text1: A goal is required for the campaign
creation.components.newCampaign2.text1: Campaign Milestones represent the concrete dates by which the assembly hopes to complete specific goals (e.g., finish proposals, forming working groups, etc.). Setup the date of each milestone of your campaign by using the slider below.
creation.components.newCampaign2.text2: Each handle in the slider represents a milestone. Slide them in the timeline to change their dates.
creation.components.newCampaign2.text3: The separation between circles represents the duration (in days).
creation.components.newCampaign2.text4: Below the timeline, each milestones is described by number with its corresponding date, according to their positions in the timeline.
creation.components.newCampaign2.text5: Milestones are organized within each component used in the campaign, as shown in the summary.
creation.components.newCampaign3.text2: An error has occurred while creating the campgaign: {{error}}
creation.components.newCampaign3.text3: An error has occurred configuring the template for the campaign: {{error}}
creation.components.versioningDescriptio: is the process by which Working Groups develop proposals to their final form
Versioning is the process by which Working Groups develop proposals to their final form.
defaultProposalComponentMilestones.endAs: Until this date, published proposals for deliberation will be open for technical evaluation by volunteers, to assess feasibility and provide expert feedback. After this date, evaluations will appear above each proposal.

Starting on this date, assembly members can explore and evaluate published proposals. When you are ready, open the voting ballot and cast your vote. You will be provided with a secret code to recover your voting ballot and update it anytime until the voting period is over.
Until this date, assembly members can edit their votes. After it, whatever vote has been casted will be considered final.
Starting this date, winning proposals will be available on the website to follow up upon their implementations
definition.assembly: Assemblies are groups of people with shared concerns, like neighborhood safety or city budgets, who want to organize to take action.
definition.campaign: Campaigns are initiatives that an assembly undertakes to achieve a specific goal. Each campaign has its own template that structures its components, working groups, and timeline.
definition.proposal.development: Assembly members organize into Working Groups to brainstorm, develop, and select proposals democratically for collective action.
Disable additional rounds of versioning: Disable additional rounds of versioning and deliberation

forum.forum.text2: The Assembly you have requested is not listed as public. If you know people who are member, ask them to send you an invitation to join.
forum.forum.text3: You are not member of this Assembly but the assembly profile is public and you can send a request to join. Press "Join Assembly" to do so.
forum.forum.text4: You have requested to join this assembly. Once a member of the assembly approves your request you will be able to see the comments and discussions in the Assembly forum as well as the list of campaigns and working groups that are part of the Assembly.
forum.forum.text5: You have been invited to join this assembly. Press the button to join the Assembly (above) to review this invitation. help.proposalTimeline: Click on the stage name to activate or deactivate the phases you wish to include in your campaign. Stages shown as disabled take place in the linked campaign.
help.tooltip.brainstorming: Ideas, issues or suggestions, made by assembly members, which can lead to the development of proposals
help.tooltip.campaignFastrack: Fastrack uses default values for each stage of a campaign (e.g., default dates and duration, default configuration values)
help.tooltip.campaignTemplate: The campaign template determines an initial configuration of the proposal development components. Linking to another campaign will bring that campaign's configuration
help.tooltip.campaignTimeframe: Select a period of time to represent in the timeline below.
help.tooltip.componentContributionTempla: A proposal template is the list of sections (with its descriptions) that are used to initialized proposal drafts
help.tooltip.coordinators: Coordinators are assembly members empowered to change settings
help.tooltip.invitations: Add one or more email addresses of people you want to invite, separated by comma, then click add to list
help.tooltip.invitationsEmail: Each invitee will receive the following email
help.tooltip.listedAssembly: If true, the 'profile' of the assembly will be searchable and public
help.tooltip.location: Can be the name of a specific place, address, city or country associated with your assembly
help.tooltip.moderators: Moderators are assembly members empowered to delete inappropriate content. AppCivist recommends that assemblies have at least two. An alternative is to allow all members to be moderators. In both cases at least two moderators must agree.
help.tooltip.proposals: Solution proposals developed by working groups
help.tooltip.supportedMembershipRegistra: Members can be invited or request to join the assembly, or both.
help.tooltip.targetAudience: Describe who you want to participate
help.tooltip.winning-proposals: List of proposals that were selected for implementation
help.tooltip.working-groups: Working Groups developing proposals based on brainstorming contributions

landing.goal: AppCivist lets users design and build their own Assemblies with modular components to organize democratic action.
landing.LoginErrorModal.text1: Something went wrong! Check your email or password.
landing.section3.desc1: AppCivist per BP è una app web per lo sviluppo e selezione collaborativo de proposte.
landing.section3.desc2: It supports the following stages, each with distinctive milestones.
landing.section3.desc3: Campaigns can be linked to each other at various stages, allowing assemblies of different kinds to collaborate.
landing.section3.title: AppCivist per Bilanci Partecipati (BP)
landing.section4.title: Customizable tools for democratic action
landing.tagline: AppCivist is a platform for democratic assembly and collective action.

appcivist.wg.membership-invitation-by-me: Ask future members to fill a registration form to join

component.ideas.enable-attachments.helpe: If enabled, ideas can have attachments
component.ideas.contribution-limit.helpe: Maximum number of ideas that can be created in this phase
component.proposals.disable-collaborativ: If disabled, the Proposal Page will not feature collaborative editing functionalities like the multi-user/real-time chat and editing of proposals

component.proposals.enable-attachments.h: Enable support for attachments on proposals

appcivist.instance.assembly-network.help: If TRUE, it allows COORDINATORS of the principal assembly to create new and manage other assemblies under the principal one.
appcivist.instance.assembly-network-limi: Number of Assemblies that can be created in the network.
appcivist.instance.assembly-network-camp: Number of ongoing Campaigns per Assembly that can be created in the network
appcivist.instance.assembly-network-work: Number of Working Groups per Assembly and Campaign that can be created in the network
appcivist.instance.etherpad-base-url.hel: Base URL of the Etherpad server in use by this instance
appcivist.instance.etherpad-api-key.help: Configures the Etherpad API key in case the coordinators decide to use their own etherpad server instance
appcivist.instance.domain.helper: When Signing in, the server will determine the principal assembly associated to the user by reading the domain from where the request is coming from
appcivist.instance.api-key.helper: A secret code that can be used by apps to connect to the API and access information of assemblies, campaigns, working groups and contributions available on this instance
appcivist.instance.theme.helper: CSS styles in this file will overwrite styles and colors of the site for anything conatined within this assembly
appcivist.assembly.enable-forum.helper: If TRUE, the assembly homepage will also feature a Forum for general discussions
appcivist.assembly.disable-new-membershi: If TRUE, only coordinators will be able to add new members to the assembly, by uploading users for them.
appcivist.assembly.membership-invitation: If TRUE, regular members can invite other users to join, otherwise only COORDINATORS have this right
appcivist.assembly.has-registration-form: If TRUE, to join the assembly, users must fill in a registration form
appcivist.assembly.enable-moderator-role: If TRUE, members can also have the role MODERATOR, which allows a member to delete content (comments, proposals, ideas, etc.), providing a reason for it
appcivist.wg.membership-invitation-by-me: If TRUE, regular members can invite other users to join, otherwise only COORDINATORS have this right
appcivist.wg.has-registration-form.helpe: If TRUE, to join the Working Group, users must fill in a registration form
appcivist.wg.enable-moderator-role.helpe: if TRUE, members can also have the role MODERATOR, which allows a member to delete content (comments, proposals, ideas, etc.)
appcivist.wg.disable-public-site.helper: if TRUE, the working group is not available in the public site
appcivist.campaign.hide-timeline.helper: If TRUE, the timeline of the campaign is hidden and the campaign has only one stage
appcivist.campaign.contribution-types.he: An array that contains the list of contribution TYPES collected in this campaign (IDEA, PROPOSAL, NOTE, etc.)
appcivist.campaign.contribution-type-pri: What type of contribution is displayed at the center of the page if a timeline with components is disabled
appcivist.campaign.disable-discussions.h: If TRUE, the comment sections of the Campaign Dashboard is disabled
appcivist.campaign.disable-public-site.h: If TRUE, the campaign does not have a public site
appcivist.campaign.disable-public-discus: If TRUE, the comment sections is hidden on the public site
appcivist.campaign.disable-informal-voti: If TRUE, up and down votes are disabled
If TRUE, up and down votes are disabled on the public site
appcivist.campaign.disable-extended-feed: If TRUE, extended feedback is disabled
If TRUE, extended feedback is disabled in the public site
appcivist.campaign.disable-new-contribut: if TRUE, contributions can only be imported by COORDINATORS, members will not be able to create ideas or proposals
appcivist.campaign.disable-etherpad.help: If TRUE, proposals do not have an etherpad extended text attached, only a description field
Dynamic 1: first N-ranked proposals that: Dynamic 1: first N-ranked proposals that can be fully funded by available budget (may result in unspent funds)
Dynamic 2: first N-ranked proposals that: Dynamic 2: first N-ranked proposals that can be fully funded by available budget, allocating all the funds (may result in 'leapfrogging')
Pin contribution to make it always avaia: Pin contribution to make it always avaialable
The 'Ideas' phase is about raising issue: The 'Ideas' phase is about raising issues and brainstorming ideas
The Proposal phase is about forming work: The Proposal phase is about forming working groups, analyzing ideas, and developing proposals
Deliberation is the careful consideratio: Deliberation is the careful consideration of proposals through comments and evidence. In this phase, proposals can only be discussed, praised or criticized, but not edited.
During implementation, winning proposals: During implementation, winning proposals are realized while assembly members monitor their progress
Idea collection begins on this day: Idea collection begins on this day
Idea collection ends on this day: Idea collection ends on this day
Proposal development begins on this day: Proposal development begins on this day
Proposal development ends on this day: Proposal development ends on this day

help.tooltip.connectWithFacebook: Social Ideation is an application that connects idea management platforms (such as AppCivist) with general purpose social networks (such as Facebook). Once you authorize this app, every time you create an idea within a Campaign of AppCivist, this will be replicated into a connected space within the target social network (e.g., a Facebook group)!
Join a Working Group to create proposals: Join a Working Group to create proposals
Connect to Facebook through Social Ideat: Connect to Facebook through Social Ideationk
Connected to Facebook through Social Ide: Connected to Facebook through Social Ideation

idea.form.themes.description: Click on the field to see the list of Themes of '{{ title }}'. Select the theme(s) that best categorize your idea (at least one).
idea.form.keywords: Add the keywords that best describe your idea. Write one keyword at a time. Press enter to confirm the keyword.
optional.survey.info: The following information will help make civic participation more inclusive and effective by letting researchers know who participates. We respect your privacy and will never publish this information anywhere. You are not required to provide this information.
Would you like to publish the name of th: Would you like to publish the name of the author along with the idea
Would you like to receive updates about: Would you like to receive updates about your idea by email?
Phone Number (if you don’t have email): Phone Number (if you don’t have email)
idea.form.author.disclaimer: Personal and identifying information, including names, emails, and phone numbers, will never be shared or published. Any survey information is confidential and anonymous, and will only be used in aggregate form to help researchers evaluate the success and effectiveness of the '{{ title }}' program.
Where will this occur? Who will benefit?: Where will this occur? Who will benefit? Why is this needed?
help.tooltip.idea.form.keywords: Example: If your idea is for new bike lanes, the theme might be "Transportation" and one keyword  would be "cycling".

voting.results.summary.intro: This is a summary of votes cast by {{participants}}
voting.modal.external-ballot.p1: Voting for {{title}} takes place outside of AppCivist. Follow this link to learn more and vote.
voting.modal.external-ballot.p2: You can still use AppCivist to view the proposals that were included on the ballot.
voting.modal.no-ballot-yet.p1: Voting Ballot for {{title}} is being prepared and will be announced soon.
voting.modal.no-ballot-yet.p2: Stay tuned and come back when is ready!
voting.stage.intro.title: Voting Phase
voting.stage.intro.contributions-summary: {{candidatesNumber}} {{entityType | lowercase}}s have been selected for this phase.
voting.stage.intro.instructions: Read the voting instructions to learn more.
voting.modal.start-voting: Press Start Voting to view the voting controls under each card
voting.modal.summary.intro.done.distribu: Congratulations! You have distributed all your points.
voting.modal.summary.intro.in-progress.d:
You still have {{points}} points remaining.
Make sure you distribute all of your points.
campaign.newsletter.subscription.questio: Would you like to subscribe to a weekly newsletter with the updates on the events in this campaign?
Would you like to sign up and receive updates about the events in this campaign?
voting.modal.save.confirmation.p1: Your votes have been saved!. You can continue editing your votes if you wish as long as the voting period is open.
voting.modal.save.confirmation.p2: When you are ready, use the Finalize Voting feature to finnish voting.
voting.modal.finalize.confirmation.p1: You are about to finalize voting. You will no longer be able to edit your votes after this.
voting.modal.finalize.confirmation.p2: Are you sure you want finish voting?.
voting.modal.finalize.done.p1: Your voting ballot has now been closed and will be counted. You can no longer edit your votes.
voting.modal.finalize.done.p2: Come back when the voting period is over to see the results!.
contribution.body: Proposals differ from ideas in that they provide a more detailed description in the form of a document that is collaboratively constructed, incorporating one or more ideas into one big project proposal.
contribution.body.empty: Expand your proposal by adding a document using one of the following services.

about.content.intro: AppCivist is a platform for democratic assembly and collaborative decision-making. It helps people tackle problems in their communities, discuss and decide on ideas for solutions, turn ideas into proposals, edit and vote on proposals, and follow their implementation.
about.content.award.p1: Premio al Servicio Público 2015-16, del Rector de la Universidad de California,Berkeley. en la categoría de colaboración Campus-Comunidad con la Ciudad de Vallejo. Más información sobre el premio, en este enlace!
about.content.award.p2: for Campus-Community collaboration with the City of Vallejo
about.copyright.text:
2018 © Regentes de la Universidad de California.
Creado por el the Social Apps Lab de CITRIS, Universidad de California, Berkeley, en asociación con el Equipo Mimove de INRIA, Francia. Desarrollado con fondos del EIT Digital, en el marco de la actividad CivicBudget, en colaboración con el TUB, Nexus, y Missions Publiques. Con contribuciones importantes de la Ciudad de Vallejo, y el Proyecto Participa de la Universidad Católica de Asunción..
about.content.copyright.team.socialappsl: Equipo del Social Apps Lab: Prof. James Holston (Director) y Dr. Cristhian Parra (Director de Diseño & Desarrollo)
about.content.copyright.team.inria: Inria MiMove: Dr. Valerie Issarny, Dr. Nikolaos Georgantas, and Dr. Rafael Angarita
about.content.license.text: Todos los componentes de este proyecto se ofrecen bajo un model de doble licencia, diseñado para satisfacer las necesidades de desarrollo y distribución de proyectos de código abierto y proyectos con objetivos comerciales. Para proyectos de código abierto, AppCivist se distribuye libremente bajo los términos de la Licencia de Código Abierto del Social Apps Lab Versión 1. Si quieres utilizar este software con objetivos comerciales, contacta a James Holston o Cristhian Parra . Para contribuir, visita nuestros repositorios en GitHub!
There are no multimedia resources in thi: There are no multimedia resources in this proposal
There are no ideas associated to this co: There are no ideas associated to this contribution
import.column.title: title*
import.column.description.source: name of the event or platform where it was collected
import.column.description.category: should match one of the pre-defined categories of the campaign
import.column.description.location: the name of the place to which the idea refers to
import.column.description.group: working group that to which the idea is assigned
import.ideas.csv-description: Each line of your CSV should represent one contribution, detailed by the following columns, with * indicating mandatory fields. The last three columns are about the author of the idea. If you have more than one author, repeat the trio of columns (name, email, phone) for each of them:
contribution.form.member-author.disclaim: Use this field to add other users, who have already signup to participate in this initiative, as authors of this contribution.
insertGdocText: Paste the URL of the Google Docs document
insertPadText: Paste the URL and API Key of your Etherpad Server
I dont have an account yet: I don't have an account yet
gdocs.disclaimer: If you want to develop your proposal using Google Docs, you first have to create a document on the Google Docs website. Be sure to select the share settings for the kind of collaboration you want. Once you have done that, copy and paste the Google Doc link below.
etherpad.disclaimer: Etherpad is an open source real-time collaborative editor, maintained by the Etherpad Community. AppCivist has its own etherpad server, so you don't need to provide a link for this, but if you have your own etherpad server, make sure you add its base URL below and API key below.
Join the Group to create proposals: Join the Group to create proposals
contribution.body.replace: You can replace your current Proposal Document from the menu. If you do, the old document will be moved to the Attachments section of the proposal with the title 'Previous Proposal Document'.
Is this resource a proposal template?: Is this resource a proposal template?
NEW_CAMPAIGN: A new campaign has been created
NEW_WORKING_GROUP: A new working group has been created
NEW_VOTING_BALLOT: A new voting ballot has been created
NEW_MILESTONE: A new event has been created
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_IDEA: A new idea has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_PROPOSAL: A new proposal has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_COMMENT: A new comment has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_NOTE: A new note has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_FORUM_POST: A new forum post has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_FEEDBACK: A new feedback has been posted
NEW_CONTRIBUTION_ISSUE: A new issue has been posted
UPDATED_WORKING_GROUP: A working group has been updated
UPDATED_VOTING_BALLOT: A voting ballot has been updated
UPDATED_CONTRIBUTION_FORUM_POST: A forum post has been updated
UPDATED_CONTRIBUTION_HISTORY: The history of the contribution has been updated
MILESTONE_UPCOMING_IN_A_WEEK: An event is a week away
MILESTONE_UPCOMING_IN_A_DAY: An event is a day away
BALLOT_UPCOMING_IN_A_DAY: The ballot is a day away
BALLOT_UPCOMING_IN_A_WEEK: The ballot is a week away
BALLOT_UPCOMING_IN_A_MONTH: The ballot is a month away
BALLOT_ENDING_IN_A_WEEK: The ballot is ending in a week
BALLOT_ENDING_IN_A_MONTH: The ballot is ending in a month
UPDATED_ASSEMBLY_CONFIGS: An assembly has updated its configuration
UPDATED_CAMPAIGN_CONFIGS: A campaign has updated its configuration
UPDATED_WORKING_GROUP_CONFIGS: A working group has updated its configuration
workinggroup.newsletter.subscription.que: Would you like to subscribe to a weekly newsletter with the updates on the events in this working group?
Would you like to sign up and receive updates about the events in this working group?
Select a format to export the proposal: Select a format to export the proposal
Select a format to export the document: Select a format to export the document
export.email.notice: For TXT, PDF, RTF and DOC formats, you will receive a link in your email to download the exported files.
export.extended.text.format.notice: Include proposal document (either GoogleDoc or Etherpad text).
landing.opensource_phrase: AppCivist is entirely free and open source for non-commercial purposes.
motivational.commentbox.message1: Participation is improved when you leave constructive comments!
motivational.commentbox.message2: Debate (conversation, discussion, deliberation) is the lifeblood of democracy.
motivational.commentbox.message5: It's not participatory unless you participate!
motivational.commentbox.message6: You can help make better proposals by leaving a comment
motivational.contributing.message1: Link the ideas here that inspired your proposal.
motivational.contributing.message2: Make sure others can see the ideas that inspired your proposal.
motivational.contributing.message3: Let others know what ideas are incorporated in your proposal.
motivational.attachments.message1: Adding attachments increases the chance of your proposal being selected.
motivational.attachments.message2: Improve your proposal by adding attachments (such as maps, images, videos, blueprints, letters, and petitions)
motivational.attachments.message3: Adding attachments helps others understand your proposal better.
motivational.attachments.message4: Attachments make your arguments more convincing.
motivational.follow.message1: Get updates about proposals you like!
motivational.follow.message2: Track other proposals as they develop!
Subscribe to Newsletters and Notificatio: S'inscrire aux bulletins et aux notifications
Unsubscribe from Newsletters and Notific: Désinscrire des bulletins et des notifications
Read the extended description of themes: Lire la description détaillée des thèmes ici
contribution.status.private-draft.descri: Rascunho Privado significa que somente os autores podem editar e comentar. Tem certeza de que deseja alterar este status?
contribution.status.public-draft.descrip: Rascunho Público significa que toda a assambleia pode ver e comentar mas somente os autores podem editar.
contribution.status.published.descriptio: Publicada significa que toda a assambleia pode ver e comentar mas ninguém pode mais editar.
contribution.summary.empty: While your proposal is a Private Draft, a summary is optional. It becomes required before you make your proposal public. Click in the edit button to provide one.
contribution.summary.empty.non-author: Cette proposition n'a pas encore de résumé.
campaign.research-consent-notification: Vos préférences pour cette recherche ont été enregistrées. Vous pouvez les modifier quand vous le voulez dans le menu d'campagne (Voir Menu => 'Revoir le consentement').
Would you like to follow this idea?: Aimeriez-vous ne plus suivre cette proposition ?
Would you like to unfollow this idea?: Aimeriez-vous ne plus suivre cette idée ?
contribution.notice.non-author-or-anonym: If this {{type}} is shared with you, sign in to access it ('Sign in', above). If it is not, ask someone listed to share it with you and then sign in.
contribution.notice.public-draft: This {{type}} has the status of Public Draft. The entire community can view and comment on a Public Draft, but only those who are shared can edit.
Keyword cannot be empty: Le mot-clé ne peut pas être vide
contribution.delete-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this contribution?
Description limit: Description can't be longer than {{limit}} characters
JoinWg successfully: Solicitud completada con éxito. Nos pondremos en contacto pronto.
Subscribed newsletters successfully: ¡Suscrito con éxito! Comenzarás a recibir boletines todas las semanas.
Voting ballot created successfully: Boleta de votación creada con éxito
